group_1.textLeft: Yes. Yours has been set up next door.
Despite there being three of you, including Nemu,@the room accommodates only one. My apologies.
Still, perhaps this is his way of thanking@you for protecting the sacred tree?

group_1.textRight: I mean, I figured we'd be put out in the fields or a@rundown shack, so this is more than enough for me!

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* I'm relieved.

group_1.narration: ―Tsuyu―@It was a gift from my father.@It's a rare bird found nowhere in Japan.
―Sana―@I know about them from the story of Tanabata, and how@they make the bridge for Orihime and Hikoboshi...

group_1.textRight: This magpie is a key element in our history.
It's mentioned in some of the materials that@have survived to the present day.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, that bird helped bring the two@Battle Shamanesses together.
So now we just need to watch and see...
I actually love cats, but having a bird around@makes it difficult to keep one.
Not to mention there's nothing we can@spare to feed them in this famine...

group_1.textRight: Are Lord Masatsuna and Mister Gen'un@still talking about the famine?

group_1.textLeft: Indeed.
I presume they're discussing how to respond to the@peasant uprisings demanding a debt moratorium.
After my conversation with Gen'un,@however,
I'm certain he's trying to convince@my father of the moratorium.

group_1.textRight: Mister Gen'un is a good man.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, he's much more concerned about the populace@than the Sumiya or Kumai ever were.

group_1.textRight: But the moratorium doesn't really solve@the problem with the famine, does it?
You mentioned earlier that this is all@being caused by Demons...

group_1.textLeft: Well...to be more precise, the Taito Gang is@manipulating the Demons to do so.
The only way to resolve the problem at@its root is to defeat the Taito Gang itself.
A peasant uprising demanding@a debt moratorium in a famine...
These sure are interesting times,@but at least we're taking a step forward.
Considering our initial goal was just finding Princess@Tsuyu, things are going way better than we thought.

group_1.textRight: Serving Tsuyu Mizuna in her manor is@nothing less than a great leap forward.
Oh, the Soul Vessel is shining...

group_1.textLeft: Have we recovered some of Iroha's concept?
Awesome!
Let's keep following history@so we can save Iroha!
